issue.title: Values isolated by NaNs on Line/Area aren't drawn

repository.name: plottable
repository.description: :bar_chart: A library of modular chart components built on D3

issue.body:
This data:

``` Typescript
var data = [
  { x: 0, y: 0 },
  { x: 1, y: 1 },
  { x: 2, y: NaN },
  { x: 3, y: 3 },
  { x: 4, y: NaN },
  { x: 5, y: 5 },
  { x: 6, y: 6 }
];
```

Gets drawn like this on `Plot.Line` and `Plot.Area`:

![screen shot 2014-10-02 at 6 00 46 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1440449/4500726/f6301cee-4a98-11e4-8ce6-943b57c88469.png)

Note that the value `{ x: 3, y: 3 }` isn't drawn because it's been isolated by invalid values. On HH points isolated in this way would be rendered as a single circle, as though they were an isolated scatterplot point. Should we implement similar logic here?

rename.from: Single points not being displayed in path
rename.to: Empty line segments not displayed in d3.svg.line.

body:
A workaround for the time-being:

``` js
line.interpolate(function(points) { return points.length > 1 ? points.join("L") : points + "z"; });
```

issue.title: JS tests fail for d3 v3.5.12

repository.name: mpld3
repository.description: An interactive data visualization tool which brings matplotlib graphics to the browser using D3.

issue.body:
29 out of 41 JavaScript tests fail for d3 v3.5.12.  (This is the d3 version that is currently bundled with mpld3; Travis JS tests currently use v3.4.13.)

The error message for the failing tests:

```
    » An unexpected error was caught: TypeError: Cannot read property 'querySelector' of undefined
```

In [d3 v3.5.4](https://github.com/d3/d3/releases/tag/v3.5.4), a dependency on a global `document` variable was removed. mpld3's JS tests use a local `document` variable; making this variable global fixes 27 tests.

Two tests need additional fixes.  d3 v3.5.7 includes a fix of a [bug](https://github.com/d3/d3/issues/2061) in d3's rendering of single point segments. This fix makes the NaN and Infinity line tests fail; adding points to the test lines (to get rid of
single point segments) is enough to fix both tests.
